page.title: 13BISHOP MIDDLEHAM FETE
page.content:
Each year in July, the village has its Parish Fete. This is now held on the school field to accommodate more stalls and people, but previously it was a modest affair held on the vicarage lawn.
It is essentially a money raising event organised by the Parochial Church Council and includes stalls and games with entertainment being provided by bands and the schoolchildren who sing or dance.
The fete normally opens with a fancy dress parade and judging. The stalls have raffles, games, home baked cakes and jams, plants and other items that have been donated by the villagers for sale. Last year the fete raised about Â£1000.
